Ecotourism: Trees could walk to tourist destinations, attracting visitors who want to experience nature up close and learn about the importance of conservation.
Forest fire prevention: Trees could walk to areas prone to wildfires, helping to prevent the spread of fires and protecting nearby homes and wildlife habitats.
Carbon sequestration: Trees could walk to areas with high levels of carbon dioxide, absorbing the gas and storing it in their roots and leaves, helping to mitigate climate change.
Biodiversity conservation: Trees could walk to areas with endangered species, providing a safe habitat and helping to increase biodiversity.
Erosion control: Trees could walk to areas prone to soil erosion, stabilizing the soil and preventing landslides and flooding.
